Hello Roger,

On Thu, May 29, 2014 at 1:15 AM, 'Coram, Roger' Roger.Coram@b=
l.uk
[archive-crawler] <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
>=
 Regarding the newer =E2=80=98URL-Agnostic Duplication Reduction=E2=80=99, =
we have our old BDB directory from a previous domain crawl. Presumably ther=
e=E2=80=99s no way to use this old data with the new beans? If not, is ther=
e any way to recreate a new-format index (and is there an equivalent of the=
 old =E2=80=98preloadSource=E2=80=99 property)?

There's no existing facili=
ty for migrating an old index to
url-agnostic. I think it would be possible=
 with some work. It would
involve dumping your old index and stuffing the i=
nfo into a new one
using the digest as the key. You might have to fake some=
 fields, like
warc record id, to get it to work. Or patch heritrix to handl=
e the
missing fields. There is no equivalent of preloadSource.

As always, =
pull requests welcome. :)

>
> Also, is it possible to deduplicate on speci=
fic content? i.e. only binary formats, only large objects, etc.

Yes. You c=
an put a shouldProcessRule on your
ContentDigestHistoryStorer (and/or Conte=
ntDigestHistoryLoader).

Noah


>
>
>
> Thanks,
>
> Roger
>
